Class FileIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • FileIO

  • public class FileIO
extends java.lang.Object
    This file is used for many file operations.
    Since:
    14-11-2014
    Author:
    Joel Peisley

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileIO()
      The default constructor, does nothing and is used to create an object.

      This function will read a file in, line by line.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileIO

        public FileIO()
        The default constructor, does nothing and is used to create an object.

    • Method Detail

      • readInShallowXML

        public static java.lang.String[] readInShallowXML(java.lang.String f,
                                                  java.lang.String r,
                                                  java.lang.String[] e)
        Will read in an entire XML file and pass back the results. After the root element the XML can only have one more level of depth.
        Parameters:
        f - The filename of the XML file.
        r - The name of the root element.
        e - All of the elements you would like to read.
        Returns:
        An array with all of the results in the order of the array you passed.

      • readInBytes

        public static byte[] readInBytes(java.lang.String s)
        Function opens the file passed and returns a byte array.
        Parameters:
        s - The name of the file to be read.
        Returns:
        A byte array with the contents of the file.

      • writeOutBytes

        public static void writeOutBytes(java.lang.String s,
                                 byte[] array)
        Function will write the byte array to the file string.
        Parameters:
        s - The filename to write to.
        array - The byte array to write.

      • log

        public static void log(java.lang.String f,
                       java.lang.String s)
        This method is used for logging. Adds the current time and date to log.
        Parameters:
        f - The file to log to. Appends to file.
        s - The message to log.

      • readInLines

        public static java.lang.String[] readInLines(java.lang.String s)
        This function will read a file in, line by line.
        Parameters:
        s - The file to read in.
        Returns:
        A String array containing the lines. Or null if there is an error.

      • readInLinesLinked

        public static java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> readInLinesLinked(java.lang.String s)
        This function will read a file in, line by line.
        Parameters:
        s - The file to read in.
        Returns:
        A LinkedList containing the lines. Or null if there is an error.

      • increaseArray

        public static java.lang.String[] increaseArray(java.lang.String[] s)
        This function will increase the size of the String array passed by 100.
        Parameters:
        s - The String array to increase.
        Returns:
        The larger String array with contents.
